intro: Dendropanax kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to southern China, particularly Guangxi, and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbel-like clusters, and it produces berries that are edible for some bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
